definition: honey pot/fig. comfortable living conditions/privileged environment

sentences.english: Honeypot skill is one of the active defense network security techniques.
sentences.chinese: 蜜罐技術是一種主動防禦的網絡安全技術。

sentences.english: Building a user-defined honeypot system can better fulfil different requirement.
sentences.chinese: 搭建自定義的蜜罐系統能夠較好的滿足不同的需求。

sentences.english: Tired of trying, and stuck fast, she looked as silly as Winnie the Pooh with his head in the honey pot.
sentences.chinese: 她的窘樣看上去跟維尼熊把腦袋卡在蜜罐裏有得一拼。

sentences.english: Honeypot is an active defense technology.
sentences.chinese: 蜜罐技術是一種主動防禦技術。

sentences.english: Allowing these to act as part of a honeypot configuration.
sentences.chinese: 允許這些行動的一個組成部分蜜罐配置。

sentences.english: If you truly want to think independently, you need to get outside your comfort zone.
sentences.chinese: 如果你真想要獨立地思考，就需要跳出自我的蜜罐。

sentences.english: A model of the cooperation system of honeypot and IDS is introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介紹了蜜罐與入侵檢測協作系統的設計模型。

sentences.english: Honeypot technology is a new initiative based on the defense network security technology.
sentences.chinese: 蜜罐技術是一種新興的基於主動防禦的網絡安全技術。

sentences.english: Today, we live in the honeypot, the Fu nest.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我們生活在蜜罐中，福窩裏。

definition: brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
pampered girl from an affluent family
precious darling (often refers to one's child)/sweetheart
the river of love/a stumbling block on the path to enlightenment (Buddhism)
lit. a pearl in the palm (idiom)/fig. beloved person (esp. daughter)
